website_summaries.verdict: This is an impressive Disney-themed game that promotes teamwork and is fun for the entire family.
pros: Appeals to kids of all ages, suitable for solo play for anyone over the age of 5
Has large and colorful game board
Incorporates beloved Disney characters and stories
cons: Some game board images are small and hard to see

customer_reviews.title: Little puzzles
customer_reviews.text: No idea how to play the real game but my 3 yr old figured out that they’re little puzzles 🧩 so win for double use
customer_reviews.author: Powpow

customer_reviews.title: Fun game for everyone!!!
customer_reviews.text: What a FUN game!!! The board is no joke 6 ft long which you need that space. There is alot to find and look for. We had ages 4 to 37 playing the game 4 people at a time. That's as many as I'd recommend playing due to size and the find it rings. Which it would be awesome if they had more of them. With 4 people playing it's about 3 rings per person... but we've had players find more than 3 items before. Give the little ones more time but the game is alot of fun and well worth $20. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: KT.S

customer_reviews.title: Quick, fun game and perfect for on the go!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old daughter received this game for Christmas. We both really like it! It took us a little bit of time to get the hang of it--at first we were spending way too long looking through our pictures, but then we learned quickly that if we don't see the object in a few seconds to just move on. Once we figured that out, the game went quickly, and we both loved playing it. I love that I can keep these cards in my purse and pull them out at restaurants or other places when we have to wait instead of handing her a gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Three

customer_reviews.title: Great portable game for travel
customer_reviews.text: This game is a brief version of the full game and so portable. The kids could easily play it when we go out to dinner without taking up too much space. They loved looking for all sorts of things while running into their favorite Disney characters. Just a warning for the older parents, the pictures are really small so if they sk you to play along, bring your reading glasses!
customer_reviews.author: Ling

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fun game! Quick and pretty easy. Our 5 year old loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Russell

customer_reviews.title: Great game for 4-10 year olds
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old daughter and our kids friends that are up to 10 years had so much fun playing this game. It goes really fast which is great for shorter attention spans. I hope to find some other themes and I will purchase those too! My husband and I enjoy playing this with our daughter. I actually prefer it over the larger game which we also have, it goes faster and is more portable (although that one is fun too)! Editing to say I believe the one I bought is the “multi”. It was only $6 when I purchased. I think that is a great value for this game. I have purchased a couple more for gifts.
customer_reviews.author: V MN

customer_reviews.title: My kids (ages 3 and 4) love this game
customer_reviews.text: My kids (ages 3 and 4) love this game, and as a parent, I find it fun as well (this can't be said for all of the kids games I play daily). The rules are easy to follow and I love that this game can be played almost anywhere (car, restaurants, etc). I have already bought this as a present for several friends, and would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: StaceyNF

customer_reviews.title: Great family game!  Buy it, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old loves playing this game, and we have gifted it to others many times. We love the teamwork aspect of the game, as well as the way it ties so many of our favorite Disney movies together in one game. We have this Disney version and a Richard Scary version, and I would say the Eye Found it series of games is a perfect family game. It helps kids to learn new words, what different things look like, as well as provides them an opportunity to develop their searching capabilities. Have recommended and gifted to friends, and would do so again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: nustorms

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: This HUGE game is wonderful. Very colorful and fun to play. Even my three year old loves searching for items on the board. Disney always does a great job but this game is a blast and I love that it helps teaches my six year old to encourage my three year old to do well in the game (since you only win if everyone finishes before the clock strikes midnight). Very well thought of family game.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Super fun family friendly game
customer_reviews.text: Such a fun game! We play it with my 2 (almost 3) & 4 year old daughters. They understand the game and are able to play. My 4 year old has sometimes got discouraged when she can’t find an item before the time runs out, but that will get better and easier as she learns and plays the game. The game board is BIG. It doesn’t fit in our dining room table so we have to play on the floor. If you have mobility issues or can’t get on the floor you may want to check that you have a table long enough to accommodate the playing board.
customer_reviews.author: technoTripp

customer_reviews.title: Fun game for all ages
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I have a 3 and 7 year old. Both love the game. We've changed the rules a little bit, as there are some issues you can run in to. For instance, when you spin, if you land on the castle clock it adds up fast, and the game ends when you get to 12. We now play that if you land on the 2 clock to add 2, you instead just lose your turn. And, we don't spin again after landing on the clock. We also play whoever gets to the castle wins, not everyone wins. But, I appreciate the collaboration of the game in eye spying.
customer_reviews.author: Meg7

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from Amazon as the seller and our game came missing a whole section of the board game, assuming this was a manufacturing defect since it appeared to be unopened when we opened it. It's a good quality game and my five and seven year olds love the busytown version and are excited to play this one. But maybe be aware of which merchant you purchase from?
customer_reviews.author: JTM

customer_reviews.title: Great family game!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the family and kids to enjoy on Christmas. And let me tell you, we spend a couple of hours playing over and over again because we were having so much fun. This game allows you to app work together as a team to rush and find as many of the specific item as possible. Was a lot of fun. We also enjoyed the fast pace of the game. I did not find this game in any way to be “too long” like some of the reviews had mentioned. All ages in the family enjoyed it. We’ll be playing this again and again. Definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: BritMcConnell

customer_reviews.title: I think this game is fun to play with the grandchildren
customer_reviews.text: I think this game is fun to play with the grandchildren. I have a few criticisms: the board is too long for the average dinner table and playing it on the floor is too hard on the knees. The objects you are trying to find are teeny, so wear glasses. And, the sand timer gives you very little time to find anything. We altered the rule about the clock hands, so we stood a better chance of getting to the end. I do like that it is a cooperative game and everyone moves together to get to the end. If you like looking for hidden pictures, this is a great children's game.
customer_reviews.author: marianne smith

customer_reviews.title: Great game. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome game that I anticipate playing a lot over the next couple years. My only criticism is that the 3+ age is a bit iffy. My son is 3.5 exactly and he still had trouble grasping the rules. He had to be told what to do at every stage of the game. Six months ago he would not have been able to play the game in any way. Perhaps some 3-year-olds who are more accustomed to rules-based board games might be able to handle it better.
customer_reviews.author: Deathblade

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating!! Could be created differently!!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 3 stars because this proved to be more difficult and frustrating for my clever 3 almost 4 yr old. You have to look for the object in pictures from OTHER cards and it's not always in the picture!!! So you can be looking and looking and then end up not finding it!!! And then have to keep flipping over cards! My child loses interest very quickly! So we just slip over a card and play "I spy with my little eye" and look for objects on our own!
customer_reviews.author: MamaNae

customer_reviews.title: Very fun game for toddlers to first grade.
customer_reviews.text: This game is a lot of fun. The rules are basic, and play is cooperative. The best part is looking for "clues" around Busytown. Everyone benefits from finding more clues, but there is a little competitive element in who can find the most clues before time runs out. The board has many whimsical and interesting things to discover, like any Richard Scarry book. Even little toddlers who can't understand the rules will enjoy looking for clues. I think your window is 2.5 to 7 years old for most enjoyment of this game (though you should watch little toddlers with the smaller pieces). We have enjoyed this game, and just gave it as a gift to another family.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC!!  Best game in our house, followed by Curious George Discovery Beach. We have Sneaky Snacky Squirrel too.
customer_reviews.text: FANTASTIC!! My 3 yr old really enjoys this game and I do too. (essential to keep mom sane) The game does everything it promises. Turn taking, cooperation, searching for items {some are really easy, many are tricky and some are down right tough} We didn't use the timer for the "search" portion of the game since she is just learning the concept. She enjoys the hunt across the giant board for each item the Gold Bug tells us to find. Hands down AWESOME. We have Racoon Rumpus, Sneaky Snacky Squirrel, Hoppy Floppy's Hunt and Curious George's Discovery Beach. This game is THE BEST and second place goes to Curious George in our house.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Great game! Worth the money! Board not made well though
customer_reviews.text: Great game for my 3 year old boy. He’s still ironing out his 1-10 number order so this helps reenforce that which I love. He also get super excited to play after the first time playing. This game would get 5 stars if the board was made from something better quality. My son accidentally ripped one of the game boards at the folding joint while putting it away last night. This morning when my wife took it out of the box another section of the board ripped along a different seam. I’ve placed duct tape along every seam now just as a precaution..... overall it’s still worth the purchase though!
customer_reviews.author: Darryl

customer_reviews.title: Quick, fun, Simple enough for 3 yr old
customer_reviews.text: W love the traditional eye found it game, but my husband has a hard time being on the floor with all the dog and cat dander. This is a great alternative for when he wants to play. It's also great for when your out and about at restaurants or anywhere else where you're sitting an waiting. The older kids and my husband and I are too quick for the 3 year old, but she understands how to play and it's easy for her as well. We just let her win every so often. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Hallie

customer_reviews.title: Better intro to board games for a 4yo than the classics!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this game and now wants to play it all the time! Its easy to learn and there is less to fight over since players work together. The board can split at folds but is easy to fix with clear packing tape. The stands for the pieces can break easy but can be replaced with about anything. So I do wish the materials were slightly more rugged since the 6ft board leads to playing on the floor. But the gameplay is just great and an easier intro to board games for my 4yo than the classics that have too many rules. Searching for the objects and working together is fun!
customer_reviews.author: Marc Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Nice game all around
customer_reviews.text: My four year old grandsons like to play this periodically. It's a fun game that focuses on working together but finding some of the objects on the Gold Bug cards can be difficult. I also found that if several kids are playing, the food items for the Pigs Eat spin go too quickly. I made a several more food items using clip art and laminating them. We love Richard Scarry so we're happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute game bad shipping packaging
customer_reviews.text: My son has the older version and loves it so I bought this newer version as a gift for a friends kid. Came super fast the only thing is they put the warehouse stickers on the front of the box and they don’t come off. So now it looks really ugly. I understand putting the stickers on boxes that get thrown away but games stay in the boxes usually.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Board Game Ever!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest game ever for little ones because you play WITH each other, not against each other! It's a cooperative game that is fun and fast moving. My granddaughters, 4,6,7 & 9 all loved it this summer - and the 13 yr old loved playing it with them as well! The concept is brilliant - I don't know how I didn't find this game a long time ago! It is now the favorite in this grandma's house!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for a 3-year-old
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to write a review on this because we have been playing it so much recently. We bought this as a game to play with our 3.5 year old son. If you have kids this age you know many board games are hard to grasp for them and/or they lose interest quickly. This has been the one that he understood right away and it actually is really fun (unlike Candyland) to play with him. Learning how to handle winning and losing is an important lesson at this age, and this game has really helped us start to teach him how to be a good sport.
customer_reviews.author: monkeyfusion

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: Enjoyable and good replay value for kids. Adults will start to remember where the different objects are the second or third time they play. Well, Trump voters won’t be smart enough to remember but the rest of us will. Don’t suggest you play on an airplane with a 2-year old, otherwise great game.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald

customer_reviews.title: Pictures are too small
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old really likes playing this game. But I would fix a few things. - The pictures are WAY too small. It's difficult to find the images. - Sometimes it's hard to find any of the images at all. - The timer is too short. - There should be more mouse ears for more players. - The characters have gotten bent by my 4 year old trying to put them in the slots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun family game, with lots of cooperative teamwork!
customer_reviews.text: A little pricey for what it is, but that’s branding for you. We love it! My five year old daughter loves searching for items and working together as a team. It’s not very competitive in comparison to most games. The timer is short and sometimes frustrating because with the wrong lighting it’s hard to find items quickly. My mother plays with us sometimes and we joke that we might add lighted magnifying glasses to our kit. But honestly, we might! Would recommend to any family!
customer_reviews.author: jj1013

customer_reviews.title: This is a pretty cute game but you run through it too fast
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty cute game but you run through it too fast. Played twice with my 7 year old and although I think it's still age appropriate, it might be really more suited for about 5 years of age. She absolutely LOVES Richard Scarry's "Cars and Trucks and Things That Go" and her favorite games are seek and find (our favorite part of the aforementioned book is locating Gold Bug on each page!). We'll play it a little bit more, then give it to someone else :)
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game for our Grandkids
customer_reviews.text: Our grandchildren really enjoy this game. Because it is so long (6') it has to be on the floor, which has proved challenging. The kids get so excited to find the items, they mis-step, or bump, or put pressure on the board with their arms while looking. Unfortunately, two of the boards broke by day two--at the seams though-- so easily fixable with some strong tape. The fix is sufficient and game play continues!!! This is a very fun game and we enjoy playing it with our grand children.
customer_reviews.author: Donna K. P.

customer_reviews.title: My new go-to gift
customer_reviews.text: Great gift idea for birthday parties where you know the parent really doesn't want just another toy that will be played with once then forgotten about. My 3 year old surprised me the first time I pulled this out to play. I wasn't expecting him to be able to focus on it and look for the pictures but he did! Of course, much of the time he would rather just look at the picture cards because all of his favorite characters are on them, and he'll try to match them up and play with them some other way. But there's really no wrong way to play so it's still great!
customer_reviews.author: Justine

customer_reviews.title: Card game for ages 3+
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 3&5 year olds because it said ages 3+. The age recommendation is incorrect. It is too difficult for the younger kids, plus there were a couple cards that my children found “scary.” Here is a photo of those- the card on the right absolutely terrified my 5 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Josh M

customer_reviews.title: It is fun for everyone
customer_reviews.text: I have three kids, now 8, 6.5 and 6.5 and they still get this game out once a week to play. It is fun for everyone. We have had it for at least three years and the little ones could play at 3yo. Another game all my kids love is Sleeping Queens. Get it - you won't be sorry. We have had Sleeping Queens for over a year and they still play it weekly.
customer_reviews.author: MidwestBec

customer_reviews.title: Quality Fun
customer_reviews.text: At first, I was frustrated w the size of the board bc it only fit on the floor (until I learned it fits on the table w the leaf in), but it's completely worth it even if playing on the floor. We had 3 generations enjoying this game. I love that the images are super small bc it creates more of a challenge. Wish it only flipped over to have more characters/scenes.
customer_reviews.author: Cami Bozeman

customer_reviews.title: Love this family game!!
customer_reviews.text: Our family loves this game! It is easy enough for even a 3 year old to participate and be successful at. The “everyone wins or everyone does not win” aspect makes it great for those younger children as well. Though not stated in the rules, you can certainly play the game so that one person is the “winner” if you choose. My only complaint is that 2 of our board pieces have torn apart at the seam (fixed with packing tape), which I think is due to current games being cheaply made as we are typically not rough with things.
customer_reviews.author: kimmberli

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Fun
customer_reviews.text: This game is lots of fun and we can pass an hour or two playing this. This is also a great educational tool since it allows young learners to observe and learn to identify objects that are the same. We end up learning a lot from this without the formal learning feel. Highly recommend, especially during this covid-19 pandemic since it can help pass time. My daughter is 4 yrs old so I play the game with her. Older children might be able to play on their own with other siblings.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo

customer_reviews.title: Great for the whole family
customer_reviews.text: My 3 yr old loves playing it though it's slightly hard for her. It will be great as she gets older. Some of the searches are hard and dont have as many but that's fine. Replay value is great. Winning isn't guaranteed which is great for teaching kids how to respond to not winning. Cooperative and fun. Nice combination of 'boy' and 'girl' playing pieces and scenes.
customer_reviews.author: SunshineGirl

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as BusyTown version
customer_reviews.text: This version has several flaws. First it's too long. It takes forever to get through a game. Second, the graphics are very small and hard to see. I recommend the BusyTown version over this one any day of the week! But this one still gets 4/5 because it's still fun and engaging for the kiddos.
customer_reviews.author: PCA34

customer_reviews.title: Same as cards. Dissapointing. Won't be used.
customer_reviews.text: If you already have the travel cards then this board is completely redundant. I didn't realize it was going to have the exact same scenes and pictures. My son was able to find everything quickly and tired of it easily. If it had different pictures than the cards he would have loved it. I bought it as a gift and had heard it was great. Friend loved it (they didn't have the travel cards) so I would buy it again as a gift. I would make absolutely sure that they didn't already have the cards.
customer_reviews.author: Ramona

customer_reviews.title: Great for Kids!
customer_reviews.text: We have been playing this with our 4.5 year old. She loves it!! Its sometimes harder for her to find the small items and we give her pointers as to where she may want to look for certain things (ie cannons are usually on pirate ships!). Its a super cute family game and we love that although one person crosses the finish first, that we don't "win" until the entire family crosses the finish -- great for teaching our little one to celebrate other's accomplishments and win together.
customer_reviews.author: Randi Gillum

customer_reviews.title: Super fun game for 4-10 year olds
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game for my 5 yr old and she liked it a lot, but I think the older kids liked it even more. Searching for the items is a lot of fun, but can get a bit competitive if you're not careful. The game holds up to kids stomping on it and crawling around, but the best part is everyone finishes at the same time to WIN!
customer_reviews.author: Martin Kollman

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful cooperative game!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful game! I love the fact that it is cooperative: all the players play against "the pigs". This is good for little kids. Either we all win or we all lose. Richard Scarry's pictures are always great -- lots and lots of detail. This game cleverly uses this. You have to find different objects on the 6-foot game board. My 4-year-old daughter doesn't like it when "the pigs eat", so when I play it with her, we don't follow the rules exactly, which is fine. I've also played it with a 5- and a 6-year old: both loved it and found it easy to follow the rules. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: C. B.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is long!
customer_reviews.text: Other than the board breaking in half after 2 times playing, it's a great game. Not a deal breaker though. Still glad I purchased it. Just be aware that it truly is 6ft long. Doesn't fit on our kitchen table and can only use on the floor. That makes it hard for adults and the baby who likes to mess with all the pieces.
customer_reviews.author: M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Grand Kids LOVE This Game!
customer_reviews.text: Awesomely cute and fun to play. My 6, 5 and 3 yo grands love it! The older ones are most capable and the game really holds their interest. The 3 yo is male and would rather destroy something or run around. The older girls are glad when he loses interest and leaves. LOL They'll play for 30 minutes or more.
customer_reviews.author: Donna M Payne

customer_reviews.title: Great for non readers on airplanes
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a plane trip with my 6y and 3.5y. We don’t watch a lot of tv so they don’t understand the significance of many of the images but they are happy to play and this game is an airplane hit. It’s great for non readers and readers, the images are recognizable (to Disney fans and adults who don’t live under a rock). I’d like it if they didn’t have a Disney branded one and I’d buy that too.
customer_reviews.author: er1n99

customer_reviews.title: Great game, highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best kids game we've purchased. You search for hidden objects while working your way to the end. It's a great game for family game night, and one my husband and I actually don't mind playing. We have given this game as a gift to friends kids, and they love it also.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley P

customer_reviews.title: Great for younger kids
customer_reviews.text: I gifted this to my 4 year old nephew for Christmas. He’s really into the Busytown book series and is a very active boy so I thought this would be a hit. It’s great for you get kids because they move around the board and it’s collaborative game. My in-laws said he’s been playing it and really enjoying it. My nephew is also really into the hide-and-seek books so finding all the objects was really fun for him.
customer_reviews.author: SFBeav

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, compact and SO much fun!!!
customer_reviews.text: Our family’s ages are 4, 5, 7, 9, 33 and 34... We ALL LOVE this game! We were recommended this from friends and immediately purchased it after playing with their family. The proceeded to gift a new one for a different family. Inexpensive, compact and SO much fun!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Son loves this simple game
customer_reviews.text: Gift for his 5th birthday. He has a couple of the books and we were excited to find Goldbug hidden in the game just as he is on every page in the book. Some questionable finds on the board but that makes things interesting with kids on what's acceptable. I do wish the game had more spaces as it's very easily won. Pigs rarely get all the food before we get to it.
customer_reviews.author: RotorBalls

customer_reviews.title: for any child
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell how pleased I'm with this boars game, I have a child with autism (4yo) and he has many challenges, starting to take turns, to count, to focus, to wonder around... everything, and we needed something attractive and challenging enough to keep him interested and engaged. This board game did it, it is a must have, and not only for special children, but also for any child that enjoys to experiment team work, we've played this with his neuro typical friends too and everyone had a blast, even though some of the children never had seen Richard Scary Busy Town cartoons.
customer_reviews.author: Farela

customer_reviews.title: Great Game!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game for my 4 year old son who absolutely loves it! We have played this game daily since I have received it. I have one complaint which is not too bad but the board has split in a couple places, we just line up the broken pieces to play the game. I guess this is an issue because the game is 6 ft long. We are still able to play the game with it broken my son just had a melt down when he thought he broke the game!
customer_reviews.author: jamie

customer_reviews.title: Best family card game ever!
customer_reviews.text: I waited a few weeks to review this to be sure we really loved it. WE LOVE IT! This is a great family game for kids and adults of all ages! Our 4 year old love it AND our 9 year old loves it, it's very hard to please both age groups with one single game. We are big Disney fans but I don't think it's a requirement to enjoy it. Best $6.00 I have spent in a while!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality of product and clear directions
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these products as part of my Christmas gifts for my 4 year old granddaughter. They will be perfect for her! I have found other items on your site that I haven't noticed anywhere else. The board game I especially will, in my opinion, help her learn how to concentrate and to enjoy it at the same time. Great item.
customer_reviews.author: Marge

customer_reviews.title: Fun Toddler Game
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game for my 4 year old. The Disney scenes catch her attention and she is so good at finding things. It's a good learning activity. The principle of the game is quick and easy to figure out and can play again and again looking for different objects. Would be great for road trips or plane rides, low on storage and playing space.
customer_reviews.author: Kaity Bendixsen

customer_reviews.title: Great game for kids and adults
customer_reviews.text: Still one of my seven year old's favorite games, even after two years and a few missing pieces. And maybe more remarkable, still a great game for adults too. It has a few collaborative elements, which makes the game friendlier, and lowers the stress level for a highly competitive youngster (and the parents playing along). Unlike other young kids games, Some of the board sections have come apart, but they're easily repaired.
customer_reviews.author: Felonious Ham

customer_reviews.title: Huge hit for all ages
customer_reviews.text: Kids 5-8 really enjoyed playing this. We loved that kids entertained themselves without needing any adults to play. But when adults were included we all had fun. Images are tiny, but that’s the challenge. We also enjoyed puzzling together the different scenes. Just FYI, the cards from the same story fit together but do not create a rectangle.
customer_reviews.author: JerseyMom

customer_reviews.title: Better then the dog 💩 game
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this game strictly off Amazon reviews. It is a finder game or eye spy which is different from your typical feeding pig or dog poop game out there now. We purchased it for my 6yr and the rest of the family enjoys playing with her. Sometimes we ditch the rules and just look for the items. I is really long, we have to play it on the floor to give everyone room. It does break of into pieces for storage
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Borter

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game for the Family
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of annoying kid games out there but this is not one of them. This is actually a fun game for kids and parents. The aspect of having to find images on the mat and place little magnifying glasses on them is what makes this game so much fun. We've played it a lot and still don't know where everything is. The kids love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: A fun game for preschoolers - Parents like it too!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I both grew up with Richard Scarry books, so it's fun to be able to pass on the characters to our kids. We have fun playing this with our 3 year old daughter, though she needs a little redirection and tends to just want to drive her car down the street! The search and find aspect when you spin a goldbug card is fun - like "Where's Waldo" with a time limit. I also like that it's cooperative. I think that's a good way to get younger kids into board games.
customer_reviews.author: PigtailGoddess

customer_reviews.title: Fan Favorite Disney Eye Found It Fun!!
customer_reviews.text: My 3-year old loves to play this game and picked it up really quick! The cards have great Disney illustrations, lots of hidden items on each card and are filled with fan favorites like Little Mermaid, Peter Pan, Pirates of the Caribbean , Frozen, Big Hero 6, Pooh, Beauty and the Beast, Cinderella, etc! Each game takes about 5 minutes to play and is really fun for all ages. I wish there was an expansion pack to add to this original deck for more eye-seeking fun!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Mestre

customer_reviews.title: What a fun game!
customer_reviews.text: I nannied a family of 3 boys (3,4,5yrs) and they introduced me to this game that they loved. They wanted to play it all the time. Even I enjoyed helping to find the items on the board. Recently, I gifted Busytown to a different boy I nanny when he turned 4. He also LOVES this game. We especially like that everyone works as a team. Everyone helps to look and find in order to get to the picnic before the pigs eat all the food. We do it as a team!
customer_reviews.author: Raven Indigo

customer_reviews.title: GREAT kids games - one of our son's favourites
customer_reviews.text: We got this game for our son when he was 3 and our daughter was 5, and years later, they both still like it and play it. It is easily one of our son's favourite games. It's got a great design, not at all boring like many of the mainstream kids' games (I'm thinking of you, Candyland, Game of Life, and all the other "roll and move" games). And most important of all, it's not boring for adults, either, which as we all know, can be hard to find in kids' games! It was a bit more expensive than other games at the time, but totally worth it. The kids have played it soooo much that I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Louise

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended family game
customer_reviews.text: This game is so fun! My almost 6 year old and 3 year old play this everyday since I bought it two months ago. I love how the card don’t take up much room, it’s really inexpensive, and the Disney theme makes it really fun for my kids to look at the different scenes. I have a fun time playing too so it’s been a nice family game that I don’t have to dread them asking me to play either. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Delaney T

customer_reviews.title: On the go game. Easy to play and lots of fun.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of our favorites. I take it in my purse everywhere. my sons are four and seven. It’s an easy game to play anywhere you have to pass time. It keeps their mind is occupied at restaurants the doctors office anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Teaches team building!
customer_reviews.text: Great game that teaches team building and attention to detail. The more players there are the harder it is to win so the kids must work together to get bonus moves. I like that there are individual players but everyone wins and losses together. It is really how the real world works with sports and work. My three year old can play it but probably better suited for 3.5 and up ( box says 4) but older sibling would still have fun with this too.
customer_reviews.author: SammyLC

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 3.5 year old
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect game for my 3.5 year old. She loves hidden picture games, so searching for all the items is a fun challenge. She’s just recently started playing board games, so this is a good beginner one. I like that it’s a collaborative game (everyone wins/loses together), so it’s not to competitive. I also like that with the element of having to search for items, there is some “skill” involved in winning, unlike other collaborative games I’ve seen (where wining is just a matter of luck)
customer_reviews.author: S. McDonagh

customer_reviews.title: It's a fun game and we like it
customer_reviews.text: After the third try, my 3-yo son was finally able to play this card game with us, even though he always comes up with new rules. I wish the cards were thicker or laminated. I mean, they are made of good quality paper but my son crunched several cards into balls the first time we opened this game before I could stop him... He doesn't seem to mind playing with the rumpled cards, though. Overall it's a fun game and we like it.
customer_reviews.author: Yada Yada Yada

customer_reviews.title: Hard for Kids
customer_reviews.text: One, the directions aren't very clear. Two, it's confusing for young kids and difficult for them. When you're not finding the hidden objects, it gets boring fast for them. I'm not a fan of the game and because it's random objects on the back of the cards, you can't use them individually.
customer_reviews.author: Been There Done That

customer_reviews.title: Great game for my 4 & 3 yr old
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4 year old but my almost 3 yr old is excited about it too (although doesn't sit and listen to the rules). My 4 year old loves I Spy books and this game is soooooo perfect for him. The board is very very long. There are lots of Find It cards. The game is interesting every time we play.
customer_reviews.author: Marcy Wellton

customer_reviews.title: An instant hit
customer_reviews.text: This game was an immediate hit with both a 5 and a 7 year old, and the adults. It's engaging on several levels, and the cooperative nature meant the normally competitive 5yo was cheering on everyone (a nice change). Good quality board and pieces. I wish there were a few more of the rings, because often we found more items than were rings available in the time given. Other than that it was perfect, and they played it multiple times in one night.
customer_reviews.author: Beth M.

customer_reviews.title: A good quick gsme
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for Easter. Thought it wouild be fun for traveling . It's really easy for kids and the can do it without knowing how to read. The back of each card has a picture of an umbrella or a bucket, ladder, etc something to find and then the front of all the cars have Disney movie scenes. You just lay your cards down and start looking. It's really fun
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Gurney

customer_reviews.title: Fun Cooperative Family Game
customer_reviews.text: I love that this is a cooperative game the whole family can play together! My daughter is almost 5 and this is her new favorite. The game is pretty big, though, so it requires the floor unless you have a really long table. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: mgreen

customer_reviews.title: Fun game for a 3 year old.
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this item I wasn't sure that my 3 year old grandson would like it. He loves it especially when searching for items on the board. My grown children have a difficuot time with the concept of everyone winning but have learned to deal with that!
customer_reviews.author: Martha Sleypen

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Littles!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun game! Great for many ages (you could adjust play for smaller kiddos). Small for travel and storage! We play this a couple of times a week (does have the potential to get too familiar with the cards/items you are looking for) but we would not play as often if we were on our regular schedule.
customer_reviews.author: MomandTeacherSTL

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT game!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely adore this game. We bought it for our 4 year old for Christmas and have played it several times already. It is a cooperative game, so you win/lose as a team (if the clock strikes midnight before one of the players reaches the castle, the game wins- If any team member reaches the castle first, the team wins). The board is FULL of hidden items and the artwork is wonderful. Great for visual scanning, counting, and cooperative play.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Swinney

customer_reviews.title: So fun for all ages
customer_reviews.text: My two and five year old love this game! My two year old just searches for items on the cards and my older son actually moves his piece and understands the whole concept of the game. I love cooperative games and how you all win together and I love to see how excited my kiddos get when searching for the card items.
customer_reviews.author: sara & buddy

customer_reviews.title: Too many drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: Too big for most tables, which meant Grandma had to crawl around on the floor (Ouch). The pictures are tiny and REALLY hard to find. I can blame my eyesight, but my four-year-old grandson couldn't see them too well either. We quit the game and while we were putting it away, he accidentally ripped apart two sections at the fold. I taped it together so it is still usable, but I would not recommend this game.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Monda

customer_reviews.title: Great Game for ALL ages
customer_reviews.text: Great game to keep a group occupied from age 3 to teens and adults. Wide range of ages can play and be entertained, great for younger kids to provide an activity to focus on and to learn more words. The illustrations are detailed, colorful, and fun.
customer_reviews.author: Julia G

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, execution leaves much to be desired
customer_reviews.text: Very detailed board but the game design mechanics were kind of dull (we had difficulty actually getting the search prompts so it started to get boring). Also the folds in the board broke easily as soon as one of the kids tried to put it away, the fold points in the board were fairly weak. Not sure how often the kids will come back to this one.
customer_reviews.author: B. Choate

customer_reviews.title: Fun and re-playable game
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game in a convenient and easily transportable package. My whole family enjoys this game and the amount of eye spy cards makes it very, very re-playable. Great to keep at home or even in the car for situations in which you need to entertain a kid for a while on the fly.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Rae London

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: The outside of the box is not the same as in the picture BUT all pieces are here and in good condition. I think the little Mickey ears are supposed to be red and these ones are yellow but we don't care! It's brand new and all pieces here :) we're playing tonight!
customer_reviews.author: Delpino

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Great family game. My kids are 8 and 4. They both love it. The 4 years old took a little longer to locate items at first, but his response time greatly improved as we continue to play the game. Both of them enjoyed the game. Finally something for the whole family to enjoy together.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Very fun game
customer_reviews.text: Love the game. It is a quick 15 minutes game and well designed. The game did not has any issue of missing parts or broken box. Everything looked intact and brand new. Very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: lilian

customer_reviews.title: Easy and fun family game!
customer_reviews.text: My kids ages range from 3-8 so it's hard to find games we can all participate in. This game is like a Where's Waldo Disney card game. The rules are simple but it's actually challenging enough spotting the items you need to spy. It's fun and a great game to play at home or outside.
customer_reviews.author: Minimodernmom

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages
customer_reviews.text: This game is a different take on eye spy, with the goal of getting to the castle before the clock strikes midnight. It's has a cooperative component and great to play with young ones. The familiar characters and long board make it easy to keep the attention of young kids new to a board game. It is a lot of fun to play as a family!
customer_reviews.author: Whatchacallit

customer_reviews.title: Actual fun for the adults as well as kids
customer_reviews.text: This is a truly enjoyable family game, which doesn't get boring from repetitive use. The 4 year old and the adults are just as valuable at completing the searches.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah G

customer_reviews.title: My kids goto board game right now
customer_reviews.text: This game is a real winner with my 3 and 5 year old boys. Whenever we have family game nights, this is the game they pull out. The rules are simple, the board is colorful, the games are relatively short, and parents won't be bored playing along. I like the "Where's Waldo" aspect of this game as it's good vision practice for young kids. It's even a good game to practice memory because you sometimes need to remember things you searched for in previous games.
customer_reviews.author: Brent V

customer_reviews.title: Not the most exciting game to play but ok for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The game gets slow if you have less then 3 players because not all of the items you have to find end up on the cards that are dealt so you have to keep drawing Cards from the pile until someone can find what is stated. Pretty good game for the price and my daughter loves the Disney scenes they have on the cards. She still likes to play it but were usually done playing it after maybe 15 minutes like most games with a 3.5 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Amy J Hill

customer_reviews.title: Fun and good for travel.
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great card game for my 4 (now 5) year old. She loves to feel like she is part of the family game night now and that we have a game she can understand and enjoy. I think next we might try the board game but for right now, she likes the quick pace of the card game. It's also nice to have a game the travels well and she likes teaching everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Glitchtastic

customer_reviews.title: Fun little card game
customer_reviews.text: Have the board game version of this, but hate how much room is needed to play. This little card game takes the best parts of the board game and puts it into a fun little box. The kids love it.. and let’s be honest, so do the adults. Great game!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Kids Love It
customer_reviews.text: I assumed I knew how to play with the cards, thinking it was just like an I spy. It is not. Once I read the directions and we played it, it was a hit for an 8 and 10 year old. They love it and want to play it over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great family game... even a 3 year old can play
customer_reviews.text: Amazing game!! after going to Disneyland this summer my 3 year old is obsessed with everything disney and i wanted to find a game she could play, i was a bit unsure if this game would be to hard for her but after explaining the rules one time she had it down and it is a game the whole family can enjoy, my husband and I also enjoying playing it. she sometimes struggle to find things but overall she loves to play it and we have a great time with it. so if you have younger kids they sill still enjoy this game along with older ones.
customer_reviews.author: Buggymom

customer_reviews.title: Great teamwork game!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4 and 6 year old to play with me on rainy days. They both enjoy it and we've played it often. The only downside is there are a lot of small parts to keep track of, which every parent knows is difficult! I like that the game is a team game. My 4 year old would often opt out of board games with the family because his older brother is so competitive and usually better at them. This give them both a chance to encourage each other and be on the same team. I recommend it for kids ages 3-8.
customer_reviews.author: 2-Step

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids!
customer_reviews.text: This game is so much fun for young kids. For reference, my kids are currently 6, 4, and 2 and they all love playing this game. I have to help my two year old with the searching portion, but my 6 and 4 year olds love the search and are very competitive about getting to the end before midnight. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Great game for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: This is a super cute travel set! My husband and I play this in teams with our toddler twins. The kids love searching for the images on the cards. I would definitely recommend this for a compact game to add to your collection!
customer_reviews.author: TwinMom

customer_reviews.title: Really fun and easy game
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game for my 3 year old's birthday and he loves it. It relatively fast and easy to learn and play. The pictures are really fun to look at, and it is simple way to help my toddler better understand taking turns and cooperative play.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great board game - bigger than standard size board games.  Great skills other games don't always have.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 4 year old for christmas. It's a really fun game! He enjoys it a lot. Fun to have the different game board - being a lot longer - we play it on the floor. Love that it teaches different skills in looking for details too. It's over pretty quickly. I definitely recommend this one and would buy again! I'd say this could even be in the 'must have' category! UPDATE: Still love this game! Fun for parents too!
customer_reviews.author: Treenz

customer_reviews.title: Fun, compact, easy game for all ages
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a quarantine game. Hoping that our kids could play solo during my work and all as a family. It has exceeded our expectations! It's a fast paced game that is appropriate for our 4 year old but also engaging for my husband and I to withstand game after game (I'm looking at you Candyland!). Highly recommend for all Disney fans and ages!
customer_reviews.author: Jen Pickford

customer_reviews.title: Excellent introduction to rules-based play.
customer_reviews.text: This is my four-year-old's favorite game. We have played it regularly, almost every day, for nearly a year. It's collaborative, hones observational skill, and has just enough of an element of chance that no two games are ever quite the same. An important quality for mom and dad when the game is a regular part of the routine. It's also been an excellent introduction to rules-based play for my child.
customer_reviews.author: ARW

customer_reviews.title: Wish the board was shorter but still a great game!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old loves this game! It's pretty fun for adults too. The board self is pretty long so it doesn't fit on our dining room table hence why it says a floor game...well that means us older folks need to crawl around on the floor too...ouch in the knees. Do wish the board would fit on a standard table.
customer_reviews.author: LP

product_meta.title: Ravensburger World of Disney Eye Found It Board Game for Boys and Girls Ages 4 and Up - A Fun Family Game You'll Want to Play Again and Again
product_meta.description: Style:Disney Eye Found It Board GameDiscover hidden treasures and beloved Disney characters on the colorful, six-foot long game board! The jumbo game board is rich with whimsical artwork and favorite Disney characters, making this game a family favorite. Join Mickey Mouse and friends on an exciting race through 12 exquisitely illustrated Disney realms, from Radiator Springs and Alice’s Wonderland to Peter Pan’s Never Land and Pooh’s Hundred Acre Wood. Throughout the race, everyone searches for iconic Disney objects ...and gets a chance to say, “I found it!”
feature_bullets: What you get – Disney Eye Found It Game comes with 1 Six-foot Game Board in three sections, 4 Movers, 4 Mover Bases, 1 Spinner, 10 Mouse-Ear Tokens, 30 Search Cards, 1 Sand Timer, and Game Rules Manual.
Clear instructions – easy to learn with a clear instruction manual. Learn to play in less than five minutes!
Develops critical skills – this game helps children practice their focus, memory, object identification, matching skills, and promotes cooperation and teamwork.
Characters you love – enjoy fun pictures of all your favorite Disney, including Mickey Mouse, Belle, Tigger, Tinker Bell, Buzz Lightyear, Alice, Woodie, Elsa and many more.
Great for kids and families – Eye Found It not just a great game for kids, but is also perfect for adults to join in on the fun. It takes just 15 minutes to play, and less than 5 minutes to teach!

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars4,197 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
